meanings.definition: Mislead someone by giving false information.
meanings.sent1: She mispleads her friend by telling a made-up story.
meanings.sent2: He mispleads customers by advertising fake products.
meanings.sent3: The magician mispleads the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent4: The mirage mispleads the travelers into thinking they see water.
meanings.sent5: The misleading sign mispleads drivers into taking the wrong exit.

meanings.definition: Mislead someone by giving a wrong impression.
meanings.sent1: His nervousness mispleads his true confidence.
meanings.sent2: The fancy packaging mispleads the actual quality of the product.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's innocent eyes misplead his mischief.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds misplead an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The actor's smile mispleads his sadness underneath.

meanings.definition: Mislead someone by making a mistake in judgment.
meanings.sent1: I misplead when I thought today was Friday.
meanings.sent2: The witness mispleads the court with inaccurate testimony.
meanings.sent3: The chef mispleads the recipe and adds too much salt.
meanings.sent4: The faulty map mispleads hikers into taking the wrong trail.
meanings.sent5: The faulty compass mispleads the direction of north.
